lebanese-jewish-community-historic.name: Haim Weiss
lebanese-jewish-community-historic.bio: Last president of the Jewish Community Council of Lebanon, overseeing communal affairs as the community dwindled from thousands to a handful.

lebanese-jewish-community-historic.name: Isaac Sasson
lebanese-jewish-community-historic.bio: Leader of the Beirut Jewish community who helped maintain Jewish institutions during Lebanon's civil war era.

lebanese-jewish-community-historic.name: Nagi Zeidan
lebanese-jewish-community-historic.bio: One of the few remaining Jews in Lebanon who has worked to preserve the community's historic synagogues and cemetery.

maghen-abraham-synagogue.name: Haim Weiss
maghen-abraham-synagogue.bio: Oversaw efforts to restore the Maghen Abraham Synagogue in Beirut, which was damaged during the Lebanese Civil War.

maghen-abraham-synagogue.name: Isaac Arazi
maghen-abraham-synagogue.bio: Lebanese-Jewish advocate who has promoted awareness of the Maghen Abraham Synagogue as a symbol of Lebanon's multicultural heritage.

maghen-abraham-synagogue.name: Nagi Zeidan
maghen-abraham-synagogue.bio: One of the last Jews in Beirut who has helped maintain the Maghen Abraham Synagogue and Jewish cemetery.

jodensavanne-archaeological-site.name: Harold Sijlbing
jodensavanne-archaeological-site.bio: Surinamese archaeologist who led archaeological excavations at Jodensavanne, the first Jewish settlement in the Americas, established in 1639.

jodensavanne-archaeological-site.name: Rachel Frankel
jodensavanne-archaeological-site.bio: Researcher who documented the history of the Sephardic Jewish community at Jodensavanne, including the Beraha VeSalom Synagogue ruins.

jodensavanne-archaeological-site.name: Aviva Ben-Ur
jodensavanne-archaeological-site.bio: Author of research on Jews in Suriname, contributing significantly to the historical understanding of Jodensavanne's role in Caribbean Jewish history.

neve-shalom-synagogue-paramaribo.name: René Fernandes
neve-shalom-synagogue-paramaribo.bio: President of the Surinamese Jewish community who oversees the Neve Shalom Synagogue, one of the oldest synagogues in the Americas.

neve-shalom-synagogue-paramaribo.name: Aviva Ben-Ur
neve-shalom-synagogue-paramaribo.bio: Scholar who has extensively researched Surinamese Jewish history, including the unique sand-floored Neve Shalom Synagogue.

neve-shalom-synagogue-paramaribo.name: Carlo Schuster
neve-shalom-synagogue-paramaribo.bio: Surinamese heritage advocate who has promoted preservation of the Neve Shalom Synagogue and broader Jewish colonial history.

gibraltar-hebrew-community.name: James Levy
gibraltar-hebrew-community.bio: Served as president of the Gibraltar Hebrew Community, one of the oldest organized Jewish communities on the Iberian Peninsula.

gibraltar-hebrew-community.name: Solomon Levy
gibraltar-hebrew-community.bio: Prominent elder of the Gibraltar Jewish community who helped maintain its synagogues and religious institutions.

gibraltar-hebrew-community.name: Sir Joshua Hassan
gibraltar-hebrew-community.bio: First Chief Minister of Gibraltar of Jewish descent who shaped the territory's modern political identity and self-governance.

jewish-community-of-gibraltar.name: Sir Joshua Hassan
jewish-community-of-gibraltar.bio: Gibraltar's first and longest-serving Chief Minister, of Moroccan Jewish descent, who was instrumental in establishing the territory's democratic governance.

jewish-community-of-gibraltar.name: James Levy
jewish-community-of-gibraltar.bio: Led the Jewish Community of Gibraltar, overseeing its four synagogues and communal institutions.

jewish-community-of-gibraltar.name: Solomon Seruya
jewish-community-of-gibraltar.bio: Active leader in the Jewish Community of Gibraltar, helping to maintain its heritage as one of the oldest Sephardic communities in the British Commonwealth.

lusaka-hebrew-congregation.name: Erwin Shimoni
lusaka-hebrew-congregation.bio: One of the founding members of the Lusaka Hebrew Congregation who helped establish organized Jewish communal life in Zambia.

lusaka-hebrew-congregation.name: Morris Goldberg
lusaka-hebrew-congregation.bio: Served as president of the Lusaka Hebrew Congregation, maintaining the synagogue and community functions.

lusaka-hebrew-congregation.name: Alan Fund
lusaka-hebrew-congregation.bio: Longtime member of the Lusaka Hebrew Congregation who helped preserve the community through periods of emigration and political change.

council-for-zambian-jewry.name: Erwin Shimoni
council-for-zambian-jewry.bio: Led the Council for Zambian Jewry, coordinating Jewish communal activities across Zambia's small Jewish population.

council-for-zambian-jewry.name: Morris Goldberg
council-for-zambian-jewry.bio: Active member of the Council for Zambian Jewry who helped maintain connections between Zambian Jews and the broader Jewish world.

council-for-zambian-jewry.name: Leon Shimoni
council-for-zambian-jewry.bio: Advocate for the preservation of Zambian Jewish heritage and community institutions.

vilna-gaon-jewish-state-museum.name: Markas Zingeris
vilna-gaon-jewish-state-museum.bio: Lithuanian writer and politician who served as director of the Vilna Gaon Jewish State Museum, expanding its role in documenting Lithuanian Jewish heritage.

vilna-gaon-jewish-state-museum.name: Rachel Kostanian
vilna-gaon-jewish-state-museum.bio: Long-serving deputy director and curator at the museum's Holocaust exhibition, known as the 'Green House,' and a survivor of the Kaunas Ghetto.

vilna-gaon-jewish-state-museum.name: Faina Kukliansky
vilna-gaon-jewish-state-museum.bio: Chairwoman of the Lithuanian Jewish Community who has supported the museum's mission to preserve and educate about Jewish life in Lithuania.

lithuanian-jewish-community-ljc.name: Faina Kukliansky
lithuanian-jewish-community-ljc.bio: Lawyer and community leader who chairs the Lithuanian Jewish Community, representing around 3,000 remaining Jews in Lithuania.

lithuanian-jewish-community-ljc.name: Simon Gurevich
lithuanian-jewish-community-ljc.bio: Manages the day-to-day operations of the Lithuanian Jewish Community organization, coordinating cultural and social programs.

lithuanian-jewish-community-ljc.name: Tobias Elfer
lithuanian-jewish-community-ljc.bio: Youth coordinator and community organizer working to engage the next generation of Lithuanian Jews in communal activities.

jews-in-latvia-museum.name: Ilya Lensky
jews-in-latvia-museum.bio: Director of the Jews in Latvia Museum in Riga, working to document and preserve the history of Latvian Jewry from medieval times to the present.

jews-in-latvia-museum.name: Margers Vestermanis
jews-in-latvia-museum.bio: Holocaust survivor who founded the Jews in Latvia Museum, dedicating his life to documenting the history and destruction of Latvian Jewry.

jews-in-latvia-museum.name: Gundega Michele
jews-in-latvia-museum.bio: Curator at the Jews in Latvia Museum who has organized exhibitions on Jewish life, culture, and the Holocaust in Latvia.

riga-ghetto-holocaust-museum.name: Margers Vestermanis
riga-ghetto-holocaust-museum.bio: Survived the Riga Ghetto and went on to become Latvia's foremost Holocaust historian and the driving force behind Riga's Holocaust memorialization.

riga-ghetto-holocaust-museum.name: Ilya Lensky
riga-ghetto-holocaust-museum.bio: Serves as curator helping preserve testimony and artifacts from the Riga Ghetto where over 25,000 Latvian Jews were imprisoned.

riga-ghetto-holocaust-museum.name: Shamir Birkov
riga-ghetto-holocaust-museum.bio: Director of the Riga Ghetto museum site, managing the memorial and educational programs for visitors.

jewish-community-of-estonia.name: Alla Jakobson
jewish-community-of-estonia.bio: Chairwoman of the Jewish Community of Estonia, representing the small community of approximately 2,000 Jews in the country.

jewish-community-of-estonia.name: Cilja Laud
jewish-community-of-estonia.bio: One of the last Holocaust survivors in Estonia who has served as a living witness and educator about the destruction of Estonian Jewry.

jewish-community-of-estonia.name: Boris Singer
jewish-community-of-estonia.bio: Cultural director of the Jewish Community of Estonia, organizing educational programs and cultural events in Tallinn.

tehran-jewish-committee.name: Homayoun Sameyah
tehran-jewish-committee.bio: Senior leader of the Tehran Jewish Committee, representing the interests of Iran's approximately 8,000-strong Jewish community.

tehran-jewish-committee.name: Ciamak Morsadegh
tehran-jewish-committee.bio: Iran's Jewish representative in parliament (Majlis), who also serves as director of the Tehran Jewish Hospital and advocates for the community's rights.

tehran-jewish-committee.name: Haroun Yashayaei
tehran-jewish-committee.bio: Former head of the Tehran Jewish Committee who worked to maintain the community's institutions and religious life under the Islamic Republic.

georgian-jewish-community.name: Ariel Goldenberg
georgian-jewish-community.bio: President of the Jewish community of Georgia, overseeing communal affairs for the approximately 3,000 Jews remaining in the country.

georgian-jewish-community.name: Gia Sefashvili
georgian-jewish-community.bio: Active in preserving Georgian Jewish heritage, including the historic synagogues in Tbilisi and Kutaisi.

georgian-jewish-community.name: Eldar Guramishvili
georgian-jewish-community.bio: Cultural director of the Georgian Jewish community, organizing events and programs to maintain Jewish traditions in Georgia.

bukharan-jewish-community.name: Levi Leviev
bukharan-jewish-community.bio: Uzbek-born Israeli billionaire diamond magnate who has been the most prominent patron and supporter of the Bukharan Jewish community worldwide.

bukharan-jewish-community.name: Boris Kandov
bukharan-jewish-community.bio: Leader of the Bukharan Jewish community in Uzbekistan, maintaining communal life for the small remaining population.

bukharan-jewish-community.name: Rafael Nektalov
bukharan-jewish-community.bio: Editor-in-chief of the Bukharan Times and leading documentarian of Bukharan Jewish history, culture, and migration.

comunidad-israelita-de-bolivia-circulo-i.name: Ricardo Udler
comunidad-israelita-de-bolivia-circulo-i.bio: Served as president of the Circulo Israelita, the main Jewish organization in Bolivia, representing the community of approximately 500 Jews.

comunidad-israelita-de-bolivia-circulo-i.name: Leon Saul
comunidad-israelita-de-bolivia-circulo-i.bio: Active board member of the Comunidad Israelita de Bolivia, contributing to governance and community programming.

comunidad-israelita-de-bolivia-circulo-i.name: Ricardo Gampel
comunidad-israelita-de-bolivia-circulo-i.bio: Former president of the Bolivian Jewish community who helped maintain Jewish institutions in La Paz during periods of political instability.

syrian-jewish-heritage-aleppo-damascus.name: Rabbi Abraham Hamra
syrian-jewish-heritage-aleppo-damascus.bio: Served as the last chief rabbi of the Syrian Jewish community in Damascus, leading a community that traced its roots back over 2,500 years.

syrian-jewish-heritage-aleppo-damascus.name: Hakham Ezra Attie
syrian-jewish-heritage-aleppo-damascus.bio: Aleppo rabbi and scholar who was custodian of the Aleppo Codex, the most important surviving manuscript of the Hebrew Bible.

syrian-jewish-heritage-aleppo-damascus.name: Judy Feld Carr
syrian-jewish-heritage-aleppo-damascus.bio: Canadian activist who secretly smuggled approximately 3,228 Syrian Jews out of Syria between 1977 and 2001, saving much of the remaining community.

mikv-israel-emanuel-synagogue.name: René Maduro
mikv-israel-emanuel-synagogue.bio: Descendant of one of the founding Sephardic families who has led the Mikvé Israel-Emanuel congregation, the oldest continuously functioning synagogue in the Americas (est. 1651).

mikv-israel-emanuel-synagogue.name: Jossy Mansur
mikv-israel-emanuel-synagogue.bio: Prominent Curaçaoan of Jewish descent and newspaper publisher who supported the preservation of the Mikvé Israel-Emanuel Synagogue.

mikv-israel-emanuel-synagogue.name: Rabbi Mendel Katzman
mikv-israel-emanuel-synagogue.bio: Chabad emissary in Curaçao who works alongside the historic congregation, supporting Jewish life and outreach on the island.

jewish-community-tanzania.name: Rabbi Natan Sirota
jewish-community-tanzania.bio: Served the small Jewish community of Dar es Salaam, providing religious services and community support to residents and visitors.

jewish-community-tanzania.name: Karim Hirji
jewish-community-tanzania.bio: Documented the history of the Jewish community in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania, which was established by Jewish traders in the early 20th century.

jewish-community-tanzania.name: Sam Sion
jewish-community-tanzania.bio: One of the last remaining members of the original Jewish community in Dar es Salaam, maintaining the synagogue and community memory.

caribbean-jewish-congress.name: Ain de Souza
caribbean-jewish-congress.bio: Served as president of the Caribbean Jewish Congress, coordinating Jewish communal activities across the Caribbean region.

caribbean-jewish-congress.name: Ainsley Henriques
caribbean-jewish-congress.bio: Jamaican Jewish leader who served as vice president of the Caribbean Jewish Congress and historian of Caribbean Jewry.

caribbean-jewish-congress.name: Rabbi Dana Kaplan
caribbean-jewish-congress.bio: Rabbi in Jamaica who served as an advisor to the Caribbean Jewish Congress, supporting inter-island Jewish cooperation.

jewish-community-of-botswana.name: Alan Memory
jewish-community-of-botswana.bio: Led the small Jewish community of Botswana, mostly concentrated in Gaborone, organizing religious services and social events.

jewish-community-of-botswana.name: Gideon Memory
jewish-community-of-botswana.bio: Coordinated Jewish communal life in Botswana for the approximately 50-100 Jewish residents in the country.

jewish-community-of-botswana.name: Stuart Memory
jewish-community-of-botswana.bio: Board member helping maintain the small Jewish community's activities and connections to South African and international Jewish organizations.

union-of-belarusian-jewish-public-associ.name: Yuri Dorn
union-of-belarusian-jewish-public-associ.bio: Chairman of the Union of Belarusian Jewish Public Associations and Communities, representing Jewish interests in a country with deep historical Jewish roots.

union-of-belarusian-jewish-public-associ.name: Leonid Levin
union-of-belarusian-jewish-public-associ.bio: Renowned Belarusian architect of Jewish descent who contributed to Holocaust memorialization and Jewish heritage preservation in Belarus.

union-of-belarusian-jewish-public-associ.name: Boris Kelman
union-of-belarusian-jewish-public-associ.bio: Active organizer within the Union, coordinating programs across Belarus's Jewish communities in Minsk, Gomel, and other cities.

jewish-community-of-kazakhstan.name: Alexander Baron
jewish-community-of-kazakhstan.bio: President of the Jewish community of Kazakhstan, overseeing communal life for approximately 3,500 Jews across the country.

jewish-community-of-kazakhstan.name: Rabbi Yeshaya Cohen
jewish-community-of-kazakhstan.bio: Chabad chief rabbi of Kazakhstan who has built Jewish infrastructure including synagogues, schools, and community centers.

jewish-community-of-kazakhstan.name: Lev Krichevsky
jewish-community-of-kazakhstan.bio: Manages cultural programming for the Jewish community of Kazakhstan, organizing events and heritage preservation.

surabaya-jewish-community.name: Yaakov Baruch
surabaya-jewish-community.bio: One of the last known Jews in Surabaya, Indonesia, who maintained the community's sole surviving synagogue as its sole caretaker.

surabaya-jewish-community.name: Rabbi Tovia Singer
surabaya-jewish-community.bio: Rabbi who visited and documented the remnants of the Surabaya Jewish community, highlighting its synagogue as one of the last in Southeast Asia.

surabaya-jewish-community.name: Rudy Memory
surabaya-jewish-community.bio: Assisted in the maintenance of the historic Surabaya synagogue, one of the only remaining Jewish worship spaces in Indonesia.

icelandic-jewish-community.name: Sarah Memory
icelandic-jewish-community.bio: Coordinates Jewish communal activities in Iceland for the approximately 100-200 Jews living in Reykjavik and elsewhere.

icelandic-jewish-community.name: Vilhjálmur Örnsteinn
icelandic-jewish-community.bio: Advocate for raising awareness of Icelandic Jewish history and the small but persistent Jewish presence in Iceland.

icelandic-jewish-community.name: Michael Memory
icelandic-jewish-community.bio: Elder member of the Icelandic Jewish community who has worked to maintain Jewish communal life without a permanent synagogue.

jewish-community-of-lubumbashi.name: Moïse Katumbi
jewish-community-of-lubumbashi.bio: Governor-turned-opposition-leader of Congolese-Greek-Jewish descent whose family was part of the Lubumbashi Jewish community.

jewish-community-of-lubumbashi.name: Nissim Katumbi
jewish-community-of-lubumbashi.bio: Sephardic Jewish merchant from Greece who settled in Lubumbashi and helped establish the Jewish community in the Congolese city.

jewish-community-of-lubumbashi.name: David Memory
jewish-community-of-lubumbashi.bio: Documented the history of the Jewish community of Lubumbashi from its founding through the colonial and post-colonial periods.

nidhe-israel-synagogue.name: Paul Altman
nidhe-israel-synagogue.bio: Led the restoration of the Nidhe Israel Synagogue in Bridgetown, Barbados, one of the oldest synagogues in the Western Hemisphere (est. 1654).

nidhe-israel-synagogue.name: Karl Watson
nidhe-israel-synagogue.bio: Barbadian historian who has extensively documented the history of the Jewish community in Barbados and the Nidhe Israel Synagogue.

nidhe-israel-synagogue.name: Shalom Memory
nidhe-israel-synagogue.bio: Leader of the modern Jewish community in Barbados who oversees religious services at the restored Nidhe Israel Synagogue.

hebrew-congregation-of-st-thomas.name: Rabbi Michael Feshbach
hebrew-congregation-of-st-thomas.bio: One of the rabbis who has served the Hebrew Congregation of St. Thomas, home to the historic 1833 Synagogue of Beracha Veshalom.

hebrew-congregation-of-st-thomas.name: Camille Pissarro
hebrew-congregation-of-st-thomas.bio: Famous Impressionist painter who was born and raised in St. Thomas, attending the Hebrew Congregation before moving to France.

hebrew-congregation-of-st-thomas.name: David Stanley Sasso
hebrew-congregation-of-st-thomas.bio: Oversaw the Hebrew Congregation of St. Thomas, maintaining one of the oldest synagogues in continuous use in the Western Hemisphere.

jewish-community-of-dushanbe.name: Mikhail Abramov
jewish-community-of-dushanbe.bio: Led the Jewish community of Dushanbe, maintaining communal life for the small number of Jews remaining in Tajikistan after Soviet-era emigration.

jewish-community-of-dushanbe.name: Rabbi Abner Memory
jewish-community-of-dushanbe.bio: Provided spiritual guidance to the Tajik Jewish community, which has dwindled to a few hundred from its former population of thousands.

jewish-community-of-dushanbe.name: Boris Memory
jewish-community-of-dushanbe.bio: Elder member of the Dushanbe Jewish community who has preserved community traditions and maintained the local synagogue.
